docs.lead_paragraph: A federal jury convicted five former executives of a health care finance company on Thursday in a $1.9 billion scheme to defraud investors.

headline.main: 5 Guilty of Fraud in Health Care Finance

docs.abstract: A federal jury convicted five former executives of a health care finance company on Thursday in a $1.9 billion scheme to defraud investors. The officials worked for National Century Financial Enterprises, described as the nation's largest health care financing firm before its 2002 bankruptcy. The five, some of the company's highest ranking executives, were convicted [...]

docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. Metzenbaum fought conservatives and big business with such effectiveness and ferocity that he became known as “the last angry liberal.”

docs.lead_paragraph: Mountain Creek, 50 miles from Manhattan, has become one of the biggest terrain parks in the Eastern United States.

docs.lead_paragraph: Fiterman Hall - the smaller-scale demolition nightmare on the outskirts of ground zero - is a step closer to coming down, the chancellor of the City University of New York said, now that federal regulators have approved a decontamination plan.

headline.main: Fiterman Hall Sees Light at the End of the Demolition

docs.abstract: A decontamination plan is approved for the 15-story building, which was damaged on 9/11. This brings its demolition one step closer, and with it, the beginnings of a newly planned college hall.
docs.snippet: A decontamination plan is approved for the 15-story building, which was damaged on 9/11. This brings its demolition one step closer, and with it, the beginnings of a newly planned college hall.

docs.lead_paragraph: The federal government reversed course and said Wednesday it would continue to cover the use of an increasingly popular procedure to detect heart disease.

headline.main: Heart Scans Still Covered by Medicare
headline.print_headline: Heart Scans Still Covered By Medicare

docs.snippet: The federal government reversed course and said Wednesday it would continue to cover the use of an increasingly popular procedure to detect heart disease.

docs.lead_paragraph: In Oregon, 91,000 residents have signed up for a lottery that provides health insurance to low-income adults who are uncovered but do not qualify for Medicaid or Medicare.

docs.lead_paragraph: Stocks retreated a day after the Fed’s $200 billion relief plan prompted the biggest rally in more than five years.

headline.main: A Day After a Big Gain, Markets Turn Wary Again

docs.lead_paragraph: A John McCain presidency would take away workers' rights and reduce their standard of living, alleges the AFL-CIO in its new online e-journal, "McCain Revealed: The Briefing Book."
docs.abstract: The AFL-CIO debuted an anti-John McCain Web site that suggests his presidency would decrease workers' living standards.
docs.snippet: The AFL-CIO debuted an anti-John McCain Web site that suggests his presidency would decrease workers' living standards.

docs.lead_paragraph: Reversing a proposed decision issued last December, Medicare said that it would continue to cover the use of a scanning procedure used to detect heart disease.

headline.main: Medicare to Keep Paying for Heart Scans
